On Apr 11, 2007, at 9:48 PM, Kenneth Stanley wrote:

> I want to mention that Jason put a lot of effort in to make this
> package user-friendly, both from the executable and source code
> standpoint.

I didn't run it (I'd love an OS X binary), but I took at look at  
Jason's code for a few minutes last night.  It is one of the cleaner  
NEAT implementations.

I do have one question.. is there some reason you guys don't sort  
your networks so that nodes only need to be updated once?  Network  
order is easily determined via BFS.  Then you just need some "same  
layer order" heuristic (such as lower innovation numbers first).   
It's a common theme in NEAT implementations - I assume because lots  
of people used Ken's original code?  Or am I missing something???

I plan on digging into the code some more in the next few days.   
Thanks for publishing it!

--Steve
--Apple-Mail-11-479873618
